intro: Senecio heteromorphus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and produces flowers in shades of purple, blue, and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Senecio heteromorphus is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
